title: chevron-right
text: WEATHER ALERT DAY: Daytime highs will be in the upper 90 to low 100s today and Saturday. Extreme heat will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities. HEAT ADVISORY is in effect from Noon Friday to 9 PM Saturday for the Kootenai/Cabinet Region, Lower Clark Fork Region, Missoula/Bitterroot Valleys and Flathead/Mission Valleys. Major risk of heat effects expected. This level of heat affects anyone without effective cooling and/or adequate hydration. Impacts likely in some health systems, heat-sensitive industries and infrastructure. HEAT ADVISORY is in effect from Noon Thursday to 8 PM Saturday for the Clearwater Mountains. Major risk of heat effects expected. This level of heat affects anyone without effective cooling and/or adequate hydration. Impacts likely in some health systems, heat-sensitive industries and infrastructure. Smoky sunshine and hot high temperatures are expected today and Saturday. Daytime highs will be in the upper 90 to low 100s. A southwest flow will bring the threat of showers and thunderstorms this weekend. Thunderstorm chances will increase on Saturday afternoon with the best chances on Sunday. Saturday, strong outflow winds will be a concern. Sunday's storms could produce heavy rainfall. Daytime highs will be in the upper 80s and low 90s Sunday.
